name: mime
content:

[ U ] the act of using movements of your hands and body, and expressions on your face, without speech, to communicate emotions and actions or to tell a story: The first scene was performed in mime.
[ C ] a short play without speech

to act or tell a story in mime: The whole of the banquet scene is mimed.
to pretend to sing, play, or say something without making any sound: Most of the bands that appear on the show just mime to a recording of their songs. He was miming something at me across the room.

the art of acting without speech, or a person who is skilled at performing this art, esp. in a theater: [ U ] In the game of charades, you have to convey the title of a movie or book through mime.
to use actions without speech to communicate something, or to pretend to speak by moving your lips but without making any sound: [ I ] The illusion of live music was created by singers miming to their records.
